poem:
"Concrete Recess"

Steel-eyed heads birthing red anthems,
Schools carved into pinched earth, stifling play.
Childhood smeared on cold slates of urgency,
Lost echoes of laughter decay.

From cuboid minds, humanity bleeds,
Shrink-wrapped joys unravel in stealth,
In tideless playgrounds, stripped of grace,
We pawn their space for wealth.

Mark well, then, this stark heist of growth,
Grim price of adult's fearful oath.
